qas.question: How many people were killed in the largest mass execution in US history?
On what date did the largest mass execution in American history take place?
In what state did the largest American mass execution occur?
What was the ethnicity of the people executed in the second-largest mass execution in US history?
In what year did the Admiralty Court hang 26 pirates in Newport, Rhode Island?
How many people were killed in the smallest mass execution in US history?
On what date did the smallest mass execution in American history take place?
In what state did the smallest American mass execution occur?
What was the ethnicity of the people executed in the second-smallest mass execution in US history?
In what year did the Admiralty Court hang 26 pirates in Kansas?

context: The largest single execution in United States history was the hanging of <a0_0><b5_0>38<b5_0/><a0_0/> American Indians convicted of murder and rape during the Dakota War of 1862. They were executed simultaneously on <a1_0><b6_0>December 26, 1862<b6_0/><a1_0/>, in Mankato, <a2_0><b7_0>Minnesota<b7_0/><a2_0/>. A single blow from an axe cut the rope that held the large four-sided platform, and the prisoners (except for one whose rope had broken and who had to be re-hanged) fell to their deaths. The second-largest mass execution was also a hanging: the execution of 13 <a3_0><b8_0>African-American<b8_0/><a3_0/> soldiers for taking part in the Houston Riot of 1917. The largest non-military mass execution occurred in one of the original thirteen colonies in <a4_0><b9_0>1723<b9_0/><a4_0/>, when 26 convicted pirates were hanged in Newport, Rhode Island by order of the Admiralty Court.
